name: Hilton Auckland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hilton in one of their apartments opposite the main hotel building. Our stay was longer than normal so we chose to have an apartment rather than just a room. It works out a little cheaper this way.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: The hotel itself is beautiful, and the rooms look fantastic. Unfortunately the apartments are not so well kitted out, but we had everything we needed, including a wonderful view over the harbour and some spectacular sunsets.
reviews.title: The Best Hilton I Have EVER Been to

reviews.text: The service was excellent - we had a couple of issues during the first week of our stay (like one of the room keys not working), but the staff sorted these out quickly and were on hand to offer help and advice where needed. They all made a point of addressing us by name whenever we wandered into reception, and were happy to chat with us if they had any spare time.
reviews.title: Treat Yourself

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would agree with others that food and drink at the hotel are very expensive - you can definitely get better deals out on the Viaduct or around town. We never ate dinner in Whites, but the a la carte breakfast was good - the buffet is over-priced.
reviews.title: one of the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The gym is decent, although the outdoor pool/sundeck area is a little smaller than it looks on the website. All in all though a great hotel with one of the best locations in Auckland - you can't beat that harbour front view, and it's an easy walk to shops and bars/restaurants.
reviews.title: Breakfasts good but pricey!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Auckland Hilton for three stays during December 2007. As a Diamond I was upgraded to a deluxe harbor view room twice and on the last stay received an upgrade to a Bow Suite looking out over Waitemata harbor. The suites are amazing with a long wall of glass and the show of boats really demonstrates why Auckland's nickname is City of Sails. And the balcony must be 100 feet long. Plus this isn't a shared balcony, you have it all to yourself. I'm not usually one to do room service but we did just to enjoy the amazing view.
reviews.title: Great Location, Service and Views@
One of the world's best Hiltons
reviews.text: On all three stays the staff was excellent and the breakfast we were given in White was delicious with a huge assortment of choices.
Overall I'd give this hotel a big thumbs up.
reviews.title: Problems on both ends of our stay

likes.disliked: — Problems before check in, at check in, and after check out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel through wotif.com, but Hilton.com will meet any competitor's rates. We loved the ship-like architecture and decor of this hotel. Our room had a lovely deck with great views, an especially comfortable mattress, and large bathroom. The staff was incredibly helpful. After our taxi driver cheated us on our fare from the airport, the hotel valet arranged for us to use another taxi company for our return trip, which resulted in a much nicer driver and a savings of $50 in taxi fare. The cocktail lounge is well-designed, has great views, and lovely wines. We are frequent guests at Hiltons and we think this is one of the best Hiltons we have ever stayed in.
reviews.title: A great hotel

likes.disliked: — nothing...however I understand that the actual rates are very high during peak season.

reviews.text: My family and I stayed here for one night at the end of our two week driving tour of Northland. We stayed in two connecting rooms on the seventh floor looking back to the city. As other reviewers have noted, this is a sleek and modern hotel, well situated right at the wharf dock. It's definitely expensive but that's because it's the Auckland Hilton! First, the positives and then the negatives: we loved our rooms. (We got a king connecting to two twin beds.) They were well equipped, plush and very comfortable. The bathroom and shower were spacious and well designed. There's an interesting outdoor pool outside the small gym. One end of the pool is transparent and you can see the front check in area four floors below. Very cool! My wife got a massage on our deck and she said it was wonderful. The decks have an eye-popping view back towards the city, but as others have observed, if there's a cruise ship docked at the wharf, it not only obscures the view, it obliterates it. We were lucky there were no cruise ships docked there when we stayed at the Hilton, but I did take a picture at the beginning of our trip for the ferry to Devenport that clearly shows how even a relatively small ship can get in your way there. That being said, the Hilton is right on the water, right on the wharf and there are literally dozens of restaurants and a few shops close by. I was able to drop off our rental car at the front check in area and the concierge facilitated the rental car agency sending someone over to drive it away so I wouldn't have to do any more navigating on Auckland streets. Prior to our trip, the concierge desk was also able to arrange personalized transportation for our family from the Hilton back to the airport when it was time to leave. So, from that standpoint, our stay there went well. But there were two glaring exceptions: I had made these reservations almost eleven months in advance. (I had reserved CONNECTING rooms as described above.) But, on the day we were to check in, I called the Hilton's front desk to reconfirm the reservations for that night. One of our two reservations had been lost and the front desk staff seemed clueless as to how to fix my problem. (If I hadn't called, we would not have the room configuration I had confirmed 11 months earlier!) Finally, a front desk clerk was able to block out the room next to the room that still had an existing reservation. I found that really surprising. Neither room was ready at the 3pm time that other guests were allowed to check in, so we had to twiddle our thumbs. The other incident occured after checkout: when I got home to the U.S. I checked my Visa statements online to verify all of the charges we had incurred in New Zealand. I was shocked to see that, in addition to the room charges that had correctly been billed to my credit card, there was a "mystery charge" at the Hilton for almost $600 NZ. It took ten emails to Hilton's front desk to sort out that the problem stemmed from the front desk clerk swiping my card twice at check in! If I hadn't looked at my account online, I wouldn't have noticed the erroneous charge until actually getting the Visa bill in the mail. My pleasant stay at the Hilton was definitely tempered by bad memories of check in gone awry (lost confirmed reservations) and surprise to see additional charges erroneously added to my bill AFTER check out.
reviews.title: Unmatched location and views!

likes.liked: — Waterfront, good value for money, spacious and conveniently located
likes.disliked: — Definately housekeeping. Speed it up guys!

reviews.text: Stayed at the Hilton Auckland 5/15-18/2008. Location is great - close to everything you could want as a tourist. The hotel is going through major renovation on the 4th floor - so pool access had to be gained by going the 5th floor and walking down to the 4th floor. No big deal. The main restaurant is under remodel as well so all dining took place on the 1st floor in the Bellini Bar - which has great view of the harbor. Breakfast was a bit over priced but still good...make sure you fill up!
reviews.title: Great Location and wonderful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As far as the Hilton chain, I feel this hotel lives up to the Hilton name. The lobby was clean, the rooms were good size and clean. We had a nice balcony overlooking the pier and harbor.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel staff was wonderful.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.text: The hotel is great, the only reason that I did not give it an excellent rating was White's restaurant where I paid more for less food than any place I have ever eaten. This was no problem as many excellent restaurants are located within a five to ten minute walk. The hotel location is fantastic, we were thrilled to be having breakfast on our balcony while a cruise liner was docking. The hotel is located at the end of Prince's Wharf which can be seen from the photo taken from the Sky Tower restaurant. Our flight arrived about 5 am so I had requested an early check-in and our room was waiting for us. The hotel staff was professional, helpful, and friendly throughout our stay. Expensive, but considering the location, well worth the cost. Spend the extra needed to have a harbor view with balcony.
reviews.title: There may be good rooms here - somewhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton in Auckland for 3 nights and highly recommend it. The hotel is located right on the water on a dock, and has great views of the water. Its located right next to everything. The hotel is very new and modern and the rooms and restaurant are very nice.
reviews.title: Overpriced

reviews.text: We stayed in the Hilton for 6 nights mid-July. We had two rooms with an interconnecting door. Not cheap per night, but the best in Auckland. Location is great, the best in Auckland. Make sure you book a room with harbour view; it’s a bit more expensive but absolutely worthwhile. The view is superb; okay, sometimes a cruise ship will block your view, but Hilton will warn you for that upon booking and the night before a ship comes in you will find a letter with all the details in your room. Room is spacious, modern and spotless. Bathroom is beautiful, nice design, great shower and separate bathtub. Breakfast is great, you can choose from several different levels, moderate priced. Staff was always very kind and professional. We had diner in the Hilton once; food and service were good, a pity was that due to off-season we were the only guests. Swimming pool is situated in a spectacular location, hanging between two buildings on the 4th floor (great location for an action movie like James Bond or Jason Bourne!); disadvantage is that it is an outside pool and it can be very windy. Although not rather cheap, we can highly recommend this Hilton. Good alternatives may be the Sebel and the Westin, both overlooking the America’s Cup Harbour.
reviews.title: The best in Auckland

reviews.text: Yes its Pretentious, but its a generally good hotel standard in a great location.
reviews.title: Very good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast when the weather is good on the terrace overlooking Auckland Harbour is fantasic.
reviews.title: Great location, great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Negative: Sometimes you will have a large cruise ship moor up next to the hotel which can be a shock when you wake up in the morning, draw back the curtains to find your seaview has been replaced by 63000 tonnes of cruise of ship. Just double check when you check in, reception will know when they expect any cruise ships in.
reviews.title: Disappointed overall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having said that I'd stay here again without a problem.
reviews.title: Best place to stay

description: Hilton Auckland sits on the iconic Princes Wharf 300 meters out into the Waitemata Harbour. Enjoy views over the city or past the harbour to the Hauraki Gulf. Take a trip from the nearby Ferry terminal or enjoy the fun at the nearby Viaduct or Britomart precincts. Whether for business or leisure, Hilton Auckland is ideally located on the vibrant Auckland waterfront.
